Let's keep fighting for all of this. Presidential politics is very unsatisfying when you're trying to push for radical change and they're trying to put together a majority coalition. Either way, let's keep fighting for it. This is not merely an intellectual exercise. It's life and death. And the real world implications of electing (or reelecting) someone who doesn't know how to run the government are particularly urgent and impactful in the middle of a pandemic that's been so much more deadly due to an incompetent President Part of an artist's job is to imagine a different future. I appreciate the desire to break free from the strictures of the 2-party system in America, for instance. But you can't divorce that conversation from the real world implications of rooting for a futile 3rd party bid. If you are going to speak out, try to do your homework. Read about it. Talk to activists and organizers and people impacted.  Be open to evolution and changing your mind. Be intentional and strategic.  And think about the impact of your words on the real lives of real people It ain't for everybody.  If you're more comfortable just making bops, do that.  We need that in our lives too! I debuted in 2004 with an album called Get Lifted.  And now, as we enter the summer of 2020, I hope this new album can get you lifted again, fill your hearts with love and inspiration, give you something to dance to, something to hold hands to, something to make love to. I’m under no illusion that music can save the world or solve the world’s problems, but I’ve always turned to music to help me through tough times and I know many of you have done the same.  That’s why I couldn’t wait to release this album to the world. But It’s important for us to continue to show the world the fullness of what it is to be black & human. Through our art, we are able to do that. This album is a celebration of love, joy, sensuality, hope, & resilience, the things that make our culture so beautiful & influential. Lately, the images of black people in the media have been showing us with knees on our necks, in mourning, or expressing our collective outrage.  We feel all those emotions. All of these songs were created prior to the world being rocked by a pandemic, prior to the latest police killings in the U.S. that sent so many to the streets in protest.  During these painful times, some of us may wonder if it’s ok to laugh or dance or be romantic. The songs are inspired by the loves of my life:  my wife, my family and the rich tradition of black music that has made me the artist I am. This project has been a labor of love for me, something I’ve spent over a year conceiving and creating.  I poured my heart and soul into these songs and collaborated with some incredibly gifted co-writers, producers and musicians. I’m so excited to introduce my new album #BiggerLove to the world.  Here’s the album cover painted by brilliant artist Charly Palmer. I'm almost 100% sure Biden won't be tweeting #DefundThePolice.  It's the job of activists to push these politicians toward meaningful change. "defund" is the word because it says we're taking away some funding from one budget item and moving it to higher priorities. "reform" or "retrain" does not at all suggest the same thing. We've been supposedly doing the latter for decades This doesn't mean there will be no police; it means there should be significantly fewer police and more professionals of other types with expertise in their fields, whether it's social work, health care, conflict resolution, drug treatment, etc Whenever there are budget cuts, those "softer" services are on the chopping block first.  And, since we know we're not solving the underlying problems, we figure we better keep a huge police force to contain them.  Let's resolve to do differently.  Let's imagine a healthier world And that choice comes at a cost. We defund housing support, health care, education and child care, the arts, drug treatment, community centers, all sorts of services that would actually reduce the problems that we ask the police to surveil and contain Police funding takes up a huge portion of our local budgets. Budgets are moral documents which spell out in black and white what our priorities are. We have finite amounts of money to spend and right now we spend far too much on policing Some intentionally want to cast the argument in extremes like that so they can score political points. But I ask that those of you who are reasonable and actually care about making this country healthy and safe for all people engage with the thoughtful arguments in this piece I know this word "defund" has caused some controversy, even from some who are inclined to agree with a lot of the underlying arguments. @andraydomise @mcuban @jonshonric Carry on bro. Have a lovely weekend
@andraydomise @mcuban @jonshonric Brilliant work
@andraydomise @mcuban @jonshonric Haha you googled my net worth and think it’s an actual source.

@andraydomise @mcuban @jonshonric I wanted Warren to be the nominee for President but the people of the party picked Biden and he was the nominee.  Ordinary people voted and chose him. Clyburn endorsement helped but the people chose.

@andraydomise @mcuban @jonshonric What is your alternative?  Have you and your buddies pick the party representatives because you know better than ordinary people in the district?  Democracy is imperfect and frustrating but the people have to decide and the candidate has to convince them somehow

@andraydomise @mcuban @jonshonric It’s not my job to know every upstart primary candidate for 435 seats in Congress. It’s their job to make themselves known to their community and win their primary. It’s difficult but it’s doable.  I don’t know what else to say. This is how you change the makeup of the House
@mcuban @jonshonric @andraydomise And AOC proved that literally going door to door and organizing locally and listening to the needs of the community could overcome the party machine.

@mcuban @jonshonric @andraydomise I agree that these are barriers to entry for disruptive candidates who don’t have party backing and financing. But they’re not insurmountable barriers, particularly in an era with many candidates who are powered by individual online smaller donations

@mcuban @jonshonric @andraydomise By the way, if the people in Pelosi’s district want to primary her and vote for someone else, they have every right to. That’s how democracy works. Again, that’s how AOC and Cori Bush and others are in the House.

@mcuban @jonshonric @andraydomise Agreed that our system needs reform. But the only way we have to do it is through.... democracy. Democracy is literally government by the people. We need to vote in the right reps and encourage them to change the laws that are harmful to the country

@mcuban @jonshonric @andraydomise The party leadership doesn’t pick their representatives. The ordinary people in the party do. That’s how we got AOC and Trump. They were both not the party leadership’s pick. If you have beef with the party’s representatives, run someone else and win the votes
@andraydomise @mcuban @jonshonric THEY WANT TO BE RE-ELECTED
@andraydomise @mcuban @jonshonric And we should continue to pay attention after we put them in office. Hold them accountable. Tell them what we want.

@andraydomise @mcuban @jonshonric Chrissy and I also raise lots of money for Feeding America and City Harvest etc but be clear that the federal government has the power and funds to do wayyyyyy more than any charity. It’s not even close. So it’s very meaningful to make sure we have the best reps in power

@andraydomise @mcuban @jonshonric What i don’t know is the marginal impact of any donation to a candidate or party or GOTV organizer. So maybe all of them have enough money to wage this election fight. But I’m donating in case they don’t and because the difference in outcomes could be quite stark and significant

@andraydomise @mcuban @jonshonric And this particular situation (GA election) will mean the difference between the Dems being in control or the GOP. So it is pivotal and the difference in outcomes could be quite meaningful in real people’s lives

@andraydomise @mcuban @jonshonric I will never put all my faith in any politician.But there are clear differences between the parties and the Democrats tend to be more willing to use government resources to aid the poor and working class (extend healthcare, increase unemployment benefits, increase min wage, Snap)

@mcuban @jonshonric @andraydomise We should care who those representatives are and try to pick the best ones. We should have campaign finance and voting rights reform and end gerrymandering to make sure our representatives are actually representative and accountable
@mcuban @jonshonric @andraydomise Any other solution (relying on the whims and largesse of unaccountable billionaires and their foundations, for instance) are inferior to democracy

@mcuban @jonshonric @andraydomise That’s democracy. But i don’t know a better alternative. We pay taxes, pool our money together, pick representatives to allocate and administer the resources in the best interest of the community and hold them accountable.

@chancetherapper Love to you, my brother. Let's keep fighting for all of this. Presidential politics is very unsatisfying when you're trying to push for radical change and they're trying to put together a majority coalition. Either way, let's keep fighting for it.
This is not merely an intellectual exercise. It's life and death.

And the real world implications of electing (or reelecting) someone who doesn't know how to run the government are particularly urgent and impactful in the middle of a pandemic that's been so much more deadly due to an incompetent President

Part of an artist's job is to imagine a different future. I appreciate the desire to break free from the strictures of the 2-party system in America, for instance. But you can't divorce that conversation from the real world implications of rooting for a futile 3rd party bid.

If you are going to speak out, try to do your homework. Read about it. Talk to activists and organizers and people impacted.  Be open to evolution and changing your mind. Be intentional and strategic.  And think about the impact of your words on the real lives of real people
It ain't for everybody.  If you're more comfortable just making bops, do that.  We need that in our lives too!

I debuted in 2004 with an album called Get Lifted.  And now, as we enter the summer of 2020, I hope this new album can get you lifted again, fill your hearts with love and inspiration, give you something to dance to, something to hold hands to, something to make love to.

I’m under no illusion that music can save the world or solve the world’s problems, but I’ve always turned to music to help me through tough times and I know many of you have done the same.  That’s why I couldn’t wait to release this album to the world.

But It’s important for us to continue to show the world the fullness of what it is to be black & human. Through our art, we are able to do that. This album is a celebration of love, joy, sensuality, hope, & resilience, the things that make our culture so beautiful & influential.
Lately, the images of black people in the media have been showing us with knees on our necks, in mourning, or expressing our collective outrage.  We feel all those emotions.

All of these songs were created prior to the world being rocked by a pandemic, prior to the latest police killings in the U.S. that sent so many to the streets in protest.  During these painful times, some of us may wonder if it’s ok to laugh or dance or be romantic.
The songs are inspired by the loves of my life:  my wife, my family and the rich tradition of black music that has made me the artist I am.

This project has been a labor of love for me, something I’ve spent over a year conceiving and creating.  I poured my heart and soul into these songs and collaborated with some incredibly gifted co-writers, producers and musicians.

I’m so excited to introduce my new album #BiggerLove to the world.  Here’s the album cover painted by brilliant artist Charly Palmer.  Check out the track list, including my amazing featured guests. https://t.co/nWu6Y2JhRH

Everyone was saying $15 minimum wage and Medicare for All and gay marriage were also unrealistic and ridiculous but activists moved the conversation and pushed politicians toward progress

It's not the job of grass roots activists on the left to craft political messaging for mainstream democratic candidates. I'm almost 100% sure Biden won't be tweeting #DefundThePolice.  It's the job of activists to push these politicians toward meaningful change.

"defund" is the word because it says we're taking away some funding from one budget item and moving it to higher priorities. "reform" or "retrain" does not at all suggest the same thing. We've been supposedly doing the latter for decades

This doesn't mean there will be no police; it means there should be significantly fewer police and more professionals of other types with expertise in their fields, whether it's social work, health care, conflict resolution, drug treatment, etc

Whenever there are budget cuts, those "softer" services are on the chopping block first.  And, since we know we're not solving the underlying problems, we figure we better keep a huge police force to contain them.  Let's resolve to do differently.  Let's imagine a healthier world

And that choice comes at a cost. We defund housing support, health care, education and child care, the arts, drug treatment, community centers, all sorts of services that would actually reduce the problems that we ask the police to surveil and contain

Police funding takes up a huge portion of our local budgets. Budgets are moral documents which spell out in black and white what our priorities are. We have finite amounts of money to spend and right now we spend far too much on policing

Some intentionally want to cast the argument in extremes like that so they can score political points. But I ask that those of you who are reasonable and actually care about making this country healthy and safe for all people engage with the thoughtful arguments in this piece

I know this word "defund" has caused some controversy, even from some who are inclined to agree with a lot of the underlying arguments. Some hear that word and envision The Purge, some dystopian descent into anarchy

Bill Withers and I when we celebrated his induction into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame. He hadn't sung in public for many years but he joined me and Stevie for "Lean on Me". Thank you for the inspiration and the… https://t.co/54zLYjkLjj

Bill and I became friends after he saw  this YouTube clip.  His friend Bill Russell (yes that Bill Russell) called him up and told him to check it out.  Then he emailed someone who then emailed my manager who then forwarded it to me. He loved our version. My year was made.
